We will change restlet repo to https://maven.restlet.talend.com. This PR is no longer needed.

FYI, https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/1726
Mark this as won't fix. Problem solved by PR https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/1645
Close due to inactive.

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @jiajunwang      
Final commit message:
## Correct getAssignmentForWagedFullAutoImpl snapshot behavior ##
This PR ensures that getAssignmentForWagedFullAutoImpl is initialized with a snapshot correctly.
Approved by @alirezazamani , ready to be merged.
This PR is ready to be merged.

This PR is ready to merge. Approve by @junkaixue and @jiajunwang 
Final commit message:
Change Workflow monitor and PerInstanceResource monitor from static metric to dynamic metric.
According to https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/300#issuecomment-460855943 `SubscribeChangeEventProcessor ` cannot be deamonized. Has the situation changed?
Approved by @alirezazamani , ready to me merged.

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @jiajunwang      
Final commit message:
## Properly clean up TaskCurrentState sessions ##
This PR fixes TaskCurrentState session clean up to be independent from regular sessions.

The test is still not stable due to a different problem. Reopen and I will keep improving it.
The new error,
> testCurrentStatePathLeakingByAsycRemoval(org.apache.helix.integration.TestZkCallbackHandlerLeak) Time elapsed: 900.016 s

The test was stuck on shutting down the routing table provider;

This PR is ready to be merged, approved @jiajunwang 

Cluster pause mode feature is going to be added. This commit adds java api to set cluster pause mode.

Thanks contributing Helix. For the description section, if you dont have a clear issue to link, please remove the checks. For other sections, if they are not applied, please leave it unselected but do not remove them.

Root caused here, https://github.com/apache/helix/issues/1748

It is no longer a test issue.

This PR is ready to merge. Approved by @junkaixue and @huizhilu 
Final commit message:
Use 1 minute sliding window size for Helix rest metrics

@mebe thanks for pointing at this ticket and comment: I was not aware of it.

Although it sounds strange to me, I am ready to accept the ``SubscribeChangeEventProcessor`` can't be daemonized. 
I have the feeling we need a way to terminate an Helix application properly though.
Otherwise it means that the application has to be killed and I don't know if that will trigger a proper "finalization of all handlers" (just quoting the comment here, I don't understand what it means).
In my experience, once the JVM has decided to stop, there's not much you can do... even in the shutdown hooks. That's why I've always considered it best to have a "clean shutown" function so the application can schedule its own shutdown properly, without any rush.
@jiajunwang Hello, could you please review this PR? I think it should be very easy for you to review. Thanks!

> @jiajunwang Hello, could you please review this PR? I think it should be very easy for you to review. Thanks!

Since @junkaixue is already reviewing the PR, could you please respond to his comment : )

@rabashizade Thanks for the PR. I just want to understand if this is the standard way to help colorblind-friendly? Do you have any official reference, like industrial standard, that indicates this would help everyone?
IMHO, adding some letters, or make the picture contains a pattern (like ðŸš«) would be more helpful. But I'm not sure if these are standard ways or not.
Approved by @junkaixue , I will merge the PR.

> @rabashizade Thanks for the PR. I just want to understand if this is the standard way to help colorblind-friendly? Do you have any official reference, like industrial standard, that indicates this would help everyone?
> IMHO, adding some letters, or make the picture contains a pattern (like ðŸš«) would be more helpful. But I'm not sure if these are standard ways or not.

Thanks for the feedback. I updated the PR description based on some industry standards and added screenshots of the changes. I also improved the colors used and added signs for the statues (checkmark for online and X for offline).

This PR is ready to be merged, approved by @jiajunwang.

**Commit message:**

Change instance status in Helix UI to be colorblind-friendly

This commit changes the instance online/offline status colors in Helix UI from green/red to blue(#2196F3)/black(#212121) to be more colorblind-friendly. The colors are chosen such that they have a contrast ratio of at least 3:1 against each other and the background. Moreover, a checkmark is placed in the icon for online status, and a cross (x) for the offline.
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/879910108
I will merge it after I finish Apache release 1.0.2

This PR is ready to be merged. Approved by @jiajunwang.

Add a Waged rebalancer util api that do not need raw zk address

Final merge message:
Remove task requested state update.

There was a bug in CI script so the link to test run was not attached.

https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/882175732

After initial triage, this failure is caused by multiple tests running in parallel. 
Will work on a PR to fix this.

The remaining ResourceMonitor is in TestClusterStatusMonitorLifecycle0_2. I suspect the problem is related to the following error log.

```
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7064179Z 1810401 [ExternalViewComputeWorker-TestClusterStatusMonitorLifecycle0_2] ERROR org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.callback.ZkAsyncCallbacks  - Interrupted waiting for success
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7069212Z java.lang.InterruptedException
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7070305Z 	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7071251Z 	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:502)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7073554Z 	at org.apache.helix.zookeeper.zkclient.callback.ZkAsyncCallbacks$DefaultCallback.waitForSuccess(ZkAsyncCallbacks.java:249)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7077636Z 	at org.apache.helix.manager.zk.ZkBaseDataAccessor.set(ZkBaseDataAccessor.java:910)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7082400Z 	at org.apache.helix.manager.zk.ZkBaseDataAccessor.setChildren(ZkBaseDataAccessor.java:856)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7087450Z 	at org.apache.helix.manager.zk.ZKHelixDataAccessor.setChildren(ZKHelixDataAccessor.java:578)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7093176Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.stages.ExternalViewComputeStage.execute(ExternalViewComputeStage.java:134)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7099273Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.pipeline.AbstractAsyncBaseStage$1.run(AbstractAsyncBaseStage.java:47)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7104274Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.GenericHelixController$3.handleEvent(GenericHelixController.java:701)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7108823Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.GenericHelixController$3.handleEvent(GenericHelixController.java:697)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7113039Z 	at org.apache.helix.common.DedupEventProcessor.run(DedupEventProcessor.java:61)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7121680Z 1810401 [ExternalViewComputeWorker-TestClusterStatusMonitorLifecycle0_2] ERROR org.apache.helix.controller.pipeline.AbstractAsyncBaseStage  - Failed to process DEFAULT::ExternalViewComputeStage asynchronously
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7127825Z java.lang.NullPointerException
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7130637Z 	at org.apache.helix.manager.zk.ZkBaseDataAccessor.set(ZkBaseDataAccessor.java:912)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7135009Z 	at org.apache.helix.manager.zk.ZkBaseDataAccessor.setChildren(ZkBaseDataAccessor.java:856)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7140459Z 	at org.apache.helix.manager.zk.ZKHelixDataAccessor.setChildren(ZKHelixDataAccessor.java:578)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7146249Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.stages.ExternalViewComputeStage.execute(ExternalViewComputeStage.java:134)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7149517Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.pipeline.AbstractAsyncBaseStage$1.run(AbstractAsyncBaseStage.java:47)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7152294Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.GenericHelixController$3.handleEvent(GenericHelixController.java:701)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7154919Z 	at org.apache.helix.controller.GenericHelixController$3.handleEvent(GenericHelixController.java:697)
2021-05-27T13:44:01.7157110Z 	at org.apache.helix.common.DedupEventProcessor.run(DedupEventProcessor.java:61)
```

We have attempted multiple times to fix this test. Although each of the fixes improves the whole system a little bit, the problem has not been completely fixed yet.
Here's the latest theory (new findings).
1. The current way of closing an async stage (EV update stage) execute thread is to interrupt it. However, since the default implementation of the task swallows the interruptedException, the thread will be kept alive.
2. From the admin thread perspective, it shuts down the async stage threads and then cleans up all the monitors. The assumption is that after the async stage threads are all closed, there won't be anyone adding new metrics. So the cleanup of the monitors should be clean.
3. However, due to the issue in point one, an EV update stage thread may still executing. It is possible that we have a race condition when an EV update stage event is being executed while the main thread is closing the monitors. If the closing of Resource Monitor happens earlier than the EV event processing, then the EV event processing will recreate a new Resource Monitor. 
 
This mainly causes problems in the test.
This test fails in: https://github.com/apache/helix/actions/runs/887454381
Assign to me!
Assign to me.

This PR is ready to be merged. Approved by @jiajunwang 

Final commit message:
Remove unused field in ZKHelixDataAccessor.
@alirezazamani Pls follow up on this

> lgtm, but seems your build failed?

Tried again and it works. I didn't find any clue like Exceptions. Moreover, I run this test in my localhost for 50 times, very stable. I think we can check-in the PR for now since we agree the change makes sense.
I will follow up if this test becomes unstable after merging.
Approved by @junkaixue , I will merge after https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/1778 since they are related.

> Handling the current use cases by swapping the custom error codes with `KeeperException.Code.APIERROR` seems a practical solution. My only concern is that perhaps with some unforeseen errors, we will get an APIERROR which is unrelated to the main cause, but for current usages that doesn't seem to be the case so this looks good to me.

Thanks for the review. For the uncertain future, my thought is that we should avoid invading into the KeeperException.Code space. Note that in the newer ZK version, they are extending the error codes. If there is a conflict, then we do not have a solution.
The right way, IMO, is add another layer of information as a supplement to the official ZK error code. I can imagine that we extend the KeeperException.Code class and add our field to it so as to indicate our detailed APIERROR. This is safer and can avoid conflict.
Approved by @rabashizade , I will merge the PR.
